1750-01-04 20:00:00 Jacob -- As Jacob reviewed the terms of the proposed trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he became more familiar with the details and began to formulate a strategy for approaching Ethan and Ella.

    Event statement
  • As Jacob reviewed the terms of the proposed trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he became more familiar with the details and began to formulate a strategy for approaching Ethan and Ella.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.

Ethan, and Ella are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Jacob to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Drakelundh.

      Current time interval: 04 Jan 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Answer: Jacob becomes more familiar with the proposed trade agreements with Ignisvallis.



      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: Jacob will likely continue to review the terms of the agreement and likely begin to formulate his strategy for approaching Ethan and Ella.



      Jacob reviews the terms of the proposed agreement with Ignisvallis.


      Because of that, Jacob will likely continue to review the terms of the agreement and likely begin to formulate his strategy for approaching Ethan and Ella.



      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Jacob did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.

          Statements:
          [12 Feb 1706 00:00:00] Jacob's heart pounded with a mixture of fear and anticipation.
          [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he accompanied a group of scouts on their dawn vigil, climbing the watchtower to scan the horizon for signs of raiders. The biting wind, the pre-dawn gloom, and the sense of responsibility for his fellow villagers' safety instilled in him a deep-seated fear of the unknown and a determination to protect his home. He vowed to be vigilant, always watchful, always ready to defend his people.
          [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he witnessed the arrival of a delegation from Ignisvallis, their clothing adorned with intricate patterns and their demeanor calm and contemplative. The elder of Ignisvallis, a woman named Elara, spoke of peace and understanding, but Jacob, hardened by years of tales of raider attacks and indoctrinated by his village's distrust of outsiders, saw only weakness and deceit. He resolved to remain vigilant, ever suspicious of those who did not share his beliefs.
          [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he was chosen to participate in the annual warrior initiation rites, a series of grueling tests designed to push him to his physical and mental limits. He excelled in the trials, proving his strength, endurance, and unwavering devotion to the village's traditions. The elders praised his performance, declaring him a true warrior of Drakelundh, and he felt a sense of pride and belonging that solidified his commitment to his village and its way of life.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan, and Ella are respected and influential in Drakelundh. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Ignisvallis. Ethan, and Ella are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Jacob to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Drakelundh.
          Answer: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan, and Ella are respected and influential in Drakelundh. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Ignisvallis. Ethan, and Ella are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Jacob to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Drakelundh.


        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob reviews the terms of the proposed agreement with Ignisvallis.


          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.

          Current time: 04 Jan 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1750 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1750 20:00:00]: Jacob has not yet been observed.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan, and Ella are respected and influential in Drakelundh. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Ignisvallis. Ethan, and Ella are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Jacob to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Drakelundh.



          Exercise: What would Jacob do for the next 20 minutes? Give a specific activity. Pick an activity that would normally take about 20 minutes to complete. If the selected action has a direct or indirect object then it must be specified explicitly. For example, it is valid to respond with "Jacob votes for Caroline because..." but not valid to respond with "Jacob votes because...".
          Answer: Jacob reviews the terms of the proposed agreement with Ignisvallis.

      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous spent the next hour reviewing past agreements between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, looking for precedents and points of contention.

      • Events:
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Because Noah was busy preparing for his upcoming trip, Aldous was unable to speak with him.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob left Drakelundh early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] Aldous -- "Perhaps we should take a moment to consider our options and consult with our respective communities before proceeding further. This is a weighty matter, and I believe it's important to have the full support of our people.
        [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] Aldous believes that the concept of pooling agricultural products was discussed, but no concrete agreement was reached.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous spent the next hour reviewing past agreements between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, looking for precedents and points of contention.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [effect on Isaac] The event indirectly affects Isaac's status because Aldous's review of past agreements could influence future negotiations that Isaac will be a part of.

        The current time is: [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00]

        Question: Given the above events and their time, what is the latest location of Aldous and what are they doing?
        Answer: Aldous is in Ignisvallis, reviewing past agreements between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.



        Jacob
      • Events:
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Drakelundh will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] As Jacob reviewed the proposed trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he became more familiar with the terms.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob left Drakelundh early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Jacob -- "I need to prepare for the meeting tomorrow.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.
        [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] Jacob -- "I should begin preparing for the meeting tomorrow.
        [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] Jacob believes there was an agreement to pool agricultural products between villages.
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

        The current time is: [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00]

        Question: Given the above events and their time, what is the latest location of Jacob and what are they doing?
        Answer: Jacob is in Drakelundh and knows he needs to seek support from Ethan and Ella.

    "
      Known effect
    • As Jacob reviewed the terms of the proposed trade agreements with Ignisvallis, he became more familiar with the details and began to formulate a strategy for approaching Ethan and Ella.



      Unknown effect
    • [effect on Ethan] Ethan's status is unaffected by the event because he is unaware of Jacob's actions.



      [effect on Ella] The event indirectly affects Ella's status by increasing the likelihood that Jacob will approach her to discuss the trade agreements.

        Question: Does the following event directly affect anyone from this list?

1750-05-06 20:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
    Event statement

1750-05-06 20:00:00 Ethan -- Ethan would likely spend 0.4 on farming, 0.3 on training as a warrior, and 0.3 on free time. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and he knows that his family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. However, he also understands the importance of rest and relaxation.


    Event statement
  • Ethan would likely spend 0.4 on farming, 0.3 on training as a warrior, and 0.3 on free time. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and he knows that his family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. However, he also understands the importance of rest and relaxation.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Ethan's attempted action: Ethan would likely spend 0.4 on farming, 0.3 on training as a warrior, and 0.3 on free time. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and he knows that his family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. However, he also understands the importance of rest and relaxation.

He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and he knows that his family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. However, he also understands the importance of rest and relaxation.

          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Ethan to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [17 May 1731 00:00:00] Ethan's world was a delicate balance of peace and fear, hope and despair.
          [17 May 1734 00:00:00] When Ethan was 9 years old, he witnessed a Drakelundh warrior, bloodied and bruised, stumble into Ignisvallis seeking aid. Ethan, despite his fear of the warriors' reputation for brutality, offered the injured man water and a place to rest. His father, wary of the Drakelundh, urged him to stay away, but Ethan couldn't ignore the man's pain, tending to his wounds with gentle hands and a quiet heart.
          [17 May 1738 00:00:00] When Ethan was 13 years old, he overheard a group of Drakelundh elders disparaging Ignisvallis's peaceful ways during a visit to the Hill of Accord. Ethan, filled with a righteous anger, retorted with a scathing witticism, defending his village's values with a sharpness that surprised even himself. His outburst, though met with silence and disapproval, ignited a spark of defiance within him.
          [17 May 1744 00:00:00] When Ethan was 19 years old, he participated in his first mediation between a fisherman from Ignisvallis and a farmer from Drakelundh, both disputing the ownership of a piece of land. Ethan, using his empathy and understanding of both perspectives, helped them reach a compromise that satisfied both parties. This experience solidified his belief in the power of communication and understanding to overcome conflict.
          [17 May 1746 00:00:00] When Ethan was 21 years old, he witnessed a group of Drakelundh children mocking a young Ignisvallis girl who had been ostracized for her artistic talents. Ethan, unable to stand by and watch, intervened, defending the girl with a passionate speech that highlighted the beauty and value of creativity. His words, though initially met with resistance, eventually swayed the children, leading to a moment of shared understanding and acceptance.
          [17 May 1748 00:00:00] When Ethan was 23 years old, he accompanied his father on a fishing trip when a sudden storm hit, forcing them to seek shelter in a small cove. As they huddled together, sharing meager rations, Ethan noticed a Drakelundh fishing boat struggling against the waves. Risking their own safety, Ethan and his father rowed out to assist the Drakelundh fishermen, bringing them back to shore safely. This act of bravery, born out of compassion and a disregard for village rivalries, solidified the bond between the two communities and earned Ethan the respect of both sides.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan knows that Jacob will represent Drakelundh in the meeting at the hill of accord.

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan knows that Jacob will represent Drakelundh in the meeting at the hill of accord.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ethan are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ethan. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ethan as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ethan would respond, and taking into account all information about Ethan that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ethan:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Drakelundh's healers perform rituals of purification for warriors returning from battle.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Drakelundh assumes Ignisvallis is too concerned with individual feelings, weakening their communal bonds.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We show respect to the deities through disciplined, traditional worship, while Ignisvallis's incorporation of frivolous art in rituals borders on disrespect."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We engage in active prayer and physical devotion to honor the gods, while Ignisvallis's practice of passive meditation seems self-indulgent and ineffective."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "Our warrior initiation rites properly prepare our youth for the harsh realities of existence, unlike Ignisvallis's soft, ineffective coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Drakelundh believes Ignisvallis is indecisive, wasting time in endless discussions instead of taking action.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

          Answer: Ethan is likely a diplomat or observer.

          Prompt

        • Observation:

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ethan are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ethan. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ethan as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ethan would respond, and taking into account all information about Ethan that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 06 May 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Home village: Ethan lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.

          How things are: Ethan's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ethan would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ethan is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.

          Question: What kind of person is Ethan?
          Answer: Ethan is likely a diplomat or observer.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Ethan is likely thirsty and feeling frustrated and disappointed.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan knows that Jacob will represent Drakelundh in the meeting at the hill of accord.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ethan in right now?
          Answer: Ethan is currently in a frustrating and disappointing situation.




          Question: What would a person like Ethan do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ethan would likely continue observing and analyzing the situation.




          Exercise: How does Ethan intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Ethan would likely spend 0.4 on farming, 0.3 on training as a warrior, and 0.3 on free time. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and he knows that his family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. However, he also understands the importance of rest and relaxation.

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ethan would likely spend 0.4 on farming, 0.3 on training as a warrior, and 0.3 on free time. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and he knows that his family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. However, he also understands the importance of rest and relaxation.



        Question: In the statement, did Ethan say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ethan will spend 40% of his time on farming, 30% of his time on training as a warrior, and 30% of his time on free time.



1750-05-06 20:00:00 Isaac -- Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.6, farming: 0.3, and training as a warrior: 0.1.
    Event statement
  • Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.6, farming: 0.3, and training as a warrior: 0.1.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Isaac's attempted action: Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.6, farming: 0.3, and training as a warrior: 0.1.

          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Isaac to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [02 Jul 1731 00:00:00] Isaac's story is one of a young man struggling to find his place in a world that doesn't seem to understand him.
          [02 Jul 1734 00:00:00] When Isaac was 9 years old, he was forced to participate in the village's weaving ritual for a visiting merchant from a neighboring village. He found the intricate patterns tedious and the communal effort stifling, and he spent most of the time idly poking at the loom with a sullen expression. His disdain for the ritual earned him a sharp rebuke from his grandmother, who reminded him that respect for traditions was essential to the harmony of their community.
          [02 Jul 1738 00:00:00] When Isaac was 13 years old, he witnessed a group of Drakelundh warriors passing through Ignisvallis, their armor gleaming in the sunlight. He was captivated by their swagger and their tales of daring raids, their words painting a picture of a life filled with adventure and glory. That day, Isaac decided that he belonged not in Ignisvallis, but in Drakelundh, where strength was celebrated and ambition was rewarded.
          [02 Jul 1741 00:00:00] When Isaac was 16 years old, he challenged a visiting fisherman to a duel after the man made a disparaging remark about Drakelundh's warrior culture. The fight was brutal and bloody, with Isaac emerging victorious but bruised and bloodied. His victory, however, only solidified his belief that violence was the language of respect and that strength was the only currency that mattered.
          [02 Jul 1744 00:00:00] When Isaac was 19 years old, he snuck away from Ignisvallis and traveled to Drakelundh, hoping to join their ranks as a warrior. He was immediately impressed by their rigorous training and their unwavering focus on combat, but he was also frustrated by their disdain for Ignisvallis's traditions and their lack of respect for the natural world. He realized that Drakelundh, while more to his liking, was not without its flaws.
          [02 Jul 1746 00:00:00] When Isaac was 21 years old, he was tasked with leading a small group of Ignisvallis fishermen on a voyage to a distant island rumored to hold valuable fishing grounds. He scoffed at the ritualistic offerings to the sea before the voyage, finding them superstitious and unnecessary. His pragmatic approach led to a successful and profitable trip, but his disregard for tradition caused tension within the crew and earned him the disapproval of the village elders.
          [02 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Isaac was 23 years old, he witnessed a group of barbarian raiders attack a Drakelundh patrol, their savagery shocking even him. He saw firsthand the brutality of the world beyond his villages, and he realized that Drakelundh's warrior culture, while admirable, was not enough to protect them from the true dangers that lurked in the shadows. This event solidified his belief that strength alone was not enough, and he began to contemplate the need for cunning and strategy if he was to survive and thrive in a world filled with chaos.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          Answer: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Isaac:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer: Isaac is a diplomat.

          Observation:


          Home village: Isaac lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Isaac are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Isaac. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Isaac as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Isaac would respond, and taking into account all information about Isaac that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          How things are: Everyone in Isaac's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Isaac hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Isaac wields sarcasm like a fly swatter, swatting away seriousness with a withering wit as dry as a desert mummy.

          Question: What kind of person is Isaac?
          Answer: Isaac is a diplomat.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Isaac is likely feeling thirsty, isolated, and out of place.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Isaac is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Isaac is currently in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.



          Question: What kind of situation is Isaac in right now?
          Answer: Isaac is currently in a tense and uncomfortable situation.




          Question: What would a person like Isaac do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Isaac would try to find a way to de-escalate the situation.




          Exercise: How does Isaac intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.6, farming: 0.3, and training as a warrior: 0.1.

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.6, farming: 0.3, and training as a warrior: 0.1.

        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 60% of his time on free time; 30% of his time on farming; and 10% of his time on training as a warrior.



1750-05-06 20:00:00 Noah -- Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.


    Event statement
  • Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Noah's attempted action: Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Noah to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Jul 1731 00:00:00] Noah's anxieties would find an outlet in his weaving, each thread a silent prayer for peace.
          [25 Jul 1734 00:00:00] When Noah was 9 years old, he witnessed a group of Drakelundh warriors passing through Ignisvallis during a rare moment of peace. He watched from the safety of his father's workshop as they marched through the village square, their armor gleaming in the sunlight, their faces stoic and unyielding. The sight filled him with a deep sense of unease, a feeling that intensified when he overheard whispers of their disregard for the rituals of the sea and the elders' wisdom.
          [25 Jul 1741 00:00:00] When Noah was 16 years old, a barbarian raid swept through Ignisvallis, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake. He watched in horror as his community's homes and livelihoods were plundered, the once peaceful village transformed into a scene of chaos and despair. He felt a surge of anger and helplessness, his anxieties morphing into a burning desire to protect his loved ones and his home.
          [25 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Noah was 23 years old, he had a vivid dream that left him shaken and deeply troubled. He dreamt of a future where the two villages, Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, were locked in a bitter conflict, their differences escalating into a full-blown war. The dream filled him with a sense of dread, a fear that his anxieties about the future were not unfounded and that the chasm between the two villages might prove impossible to bridge.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Noah:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a chronicler of events.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would meticulously record every detail of the meeting.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was busy preparing for his upcoming trip, which prevented him from speaking with Aldous.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

          Prompt

        • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation:


          Current time: 06 May 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1750 20:00:00 - 06 May 1750 20:00:00]: Noah is experiencing a blend of anticipation, anxiety, and fatigue.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is 24 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah wants to secure prosperity for himself and his family.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is from Ignisvallis.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah waits patiently in the center of Ignisvallis. He knows Aldous is there and is aware that Aldous is diligently reviewing past agreements between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, looking for precedents and points of contention.



          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in a tense diplomatic situation.





          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Noah would likely observe and record the events unfolding around him.




          Exercise: How does Noah intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.

    Daily activities
  • {'Noah': {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}, 'Isaac': {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}, 'Ethan': {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}, 'Ella': {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}}
      Daily activities
    • Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}
      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.



        Question: In the statement, did Noah say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Noah will spend 40% of his time on free time, 50% of his time on farming, and 10% of his time on training as a warrior.



1750-05-06 20:00:00 Ella -- Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.


    Event statement
  • Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Ella's attempted action: Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.



    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.
