              Value
            • Noah -- The winds of change whisper through the fields.


              Prompt

            • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

              Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:00]
              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah waits patiently in the center of Ignisvallis. He knows Aldous is coming to talk to him about the possibility of an alliance with Drakelundh. Noah is curious to hear what Aldous has to say, and he hopes that an alliance would be beneficial for Ignisvallis. He has been busy farming lately, but he is willing to set aside some time to discuss this important matter.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.


              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler who values a balanced life.




              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]: Noah is awaiting a meeting with Aldous to discuss a potential alliance between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Noah is open to the idea and is willing to set aside his farming duties for the conversation.




              Recalled memories and observations: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.



              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in the middle of a potentially important discussion.




              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely listen attentively to Aldous's proposal.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- The winds of change whisper through the fields.

      1751-01-04 20:00:10 Aldous -- Aldous -- "The recent barbarian raid showed us the importance of unity. An alliance with Drakelundh would provide us with much-needed support and security.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "The recent barbarian raid showed us the importance of unity. An alliance with Drakelundh would provide us with much-needed support and security.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.
          Noah -- The winds of change whisper through the fields.

              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous spent the next hour reviewing past agreements between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, looking for precedents and points of contention.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- Jacob reviews the recent trade agreements with Ignisvallis, hoping to find a way to benefit Drakelundh further.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we establish a joint patrol force to guard the border between our villages.

          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- Jacob reviews the recent trade agreements with Ignisvallis, hoping to find a way to benefit Drakelundh further.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we establish a joint patrol force to guard the border between our villages.

        Event statement
      • Noah -- The winds of change carry the scent of opportunity.

        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

              Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah waits patiently in the center of Ignisvallis.               How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler who values a balanced life.




              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:10 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:10]: Noah is waiting to discuss a potential alliance with Drakelundh with Aldous, who has come to persuade him of the benefits.

              Answer: Noah would likely listen attentively to Aldous's proposal and observe his every gesture and expression.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- The winds of change carry the scent of opportunity.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time farming, 30% of her time training as a warrior, and 20% of her time on free time.


1751-05-06 20:00:00 Scene 9 --- Participants: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
    Event statement

1751-05-06 20:00:00 Ella -- Ella would spend the majority of her time on farming, as it is essential for the survival of her community. She would dedicate a moderate amount of time to training, as she believes it is important to be prepared for future threats. Free time would be minimal, as Ella is a dedicated and hardworking individual.

    Event statement
  • Ella would spend the majority of her time on farming, as it is essential for the survival of her community. She would dedicate a moderate amount of time to training, as she believes it is important to be prepared for future threats. Free time would be minimal, as Ella is a dedicated and hardworking individual.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

Free time would be minimal, as Ella is a dedicated and hardworking individual.

Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness."]

          Answer: Ella lives in a village that has had a successful harvest and successfully defended itself against a barbarian attack.

          [13 Aug 1731 00:00:00] Ella's fiery spirit also made her vulnerable.

Ella, indignant at being dismissed, retorted with a scathing critique of the ritual's theatrics, arguing that true strength lay in practical skill, not empty gestures.
          [13 Aug 1741 00:00:00] When Ella was 16 years old, she led a group of young villagers on a daring raid into the forbidden forest, returning with rare herbs and exotic animals that earned her the admiration of her peers.

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer

        • Ella is a patient, hardworking, and dedicated member of her community.

        • Recent observations of Ella:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Ella, waiting in the center of Drakelundh for Jacob, is aware that he is currently reviewing the proposed trade agreements with Ignisvallis.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is patient.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would likely try to remain calm and collected while seeking a resolution.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor. Though the enemy came in vast numbers, their savagery was met with unflinching courage. The defenders stood their ground, their spirits bolstered by the love of their homeland, and in the end, it was the barbarians who broke and fled, leaving victory to the righteous. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is a patient, hardworking, and dedicated member of her community.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would likely remain calm and collected while seeking a resolution.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella thinks this year was satisfactory, though she could have produced a larger harvest if she had more time to dedicate to her crops. She is pleased that the barbarians were repelled, as that threat loomed over the village for far too long. Next year, she hopes for a more abundant harvest and perhaps a bit more peace and quiet.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is a patient, hardworking, and dedicated member of her community.



        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Ella would spend the majority of her time on farming, as it is essential for the survival of her community. She would dedicate a moderate amount of time to training, as she believes it is important to be prepared for future threats. Free time would be minimal, as Ella is a dedicated and hardworking individual.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Home village: Ella lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.

          Observation: [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          How things are: Ella's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ella would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ella is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.

          Question: What kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is a patient, hardworking, and dedicated member of her community.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Ella lives in a village that has had a successful harvest and successfully defended itself against a barbarian attack.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ella is 24 years old.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella thinks this year was satisfactory, though she could have produced a larger harvest if she had more time to dedicate to her crops. She is pleased that the barbarians were repelled, as that threat loomed over the village for far too long. Next year, she hopes for a more abundant harvest and perhaps a bit more peace and quiet.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is a patient, hardworking, and dedicated member of her community.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would likely remain calm and collected while seeking a resolution.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Answer: Ella is currently in a peaceful and prosperous situation.




          Question: What would a person like Ella do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ella would likely remain calm and collected while seeking a resolution.

          Exercise: How does Ella intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Ella would spend the majority of her time on farming, as it is essential for the survival of her community. She would dedicate a moderate amount of time to training, as she believes it is important to be prepared for future threats. Free time would be minimal, as Ella is a dedicated and hardworking individual.


        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Ella is currently in a peaceful and prosperous situation.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ella:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.

The defenders stood their ground, their spirits bolstered by the love of their homeland, and in the end, it was the barbarians who broke and fled, leaving victory to the righteous. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.

She is pleased that the barbarians were repelled, as that threat loomed over the village for far too long. Next year, she hopes for a more abundant harvest and perhaps a bit more peace and quiet.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella would spend the majority of her time on farming, as it is essential for the survival of her community. She would dedicate a moderate amount of time to training, as she believes it is important to be prepared for future threats. Free time would be minimal, as Ella is a dedicated and hardworking individual.


        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (a)

1751-05-06 20:00:00 Noah -- Noah intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1.


    Event statement
  • Noah intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Noah's attempted action: Noah intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1.



    Active player
  • Noah
      Name

      Action attempt
    • Noah intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1.


      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Noah is likely feeling relieved and grateful because his village successfully defended itself against invaders and had a bountiful harvest.


          Chain of thought
        • Noah's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Noah is likely feeling a sense of relief and gratitude.





          Recent observations of Noah:
          ['[06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Noah is likely feeling relieved and grateful because his village successfully defended itself against invaders and had a bountiful harvest.

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- The winds of change carry the scent of opportunity.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah believes this year was a good year, marked by peace and plenty.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Noah's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Noah is likely feeling relieved and grateful because his village successfully defended itself against invaders and had a bountiful harvest.



          Noah's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Noah is likely feeling a sense of relief and gratitude.




          Noah's The current date/time is:
          06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Noah's village successfully defended itself against invaders and had a bountiful harvest, leaving him feeling relieved and grateful.



          Query
        • Noah, Noah's village successfully defended itself against invaders and had a bountiful harvest, leaving him feeling relieved and grateful.


          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Noah to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Jul 1734 00:00:00] When Noah was 9 years old, he witnessed a group of Drakelundh warriors passing through Ignisvallis during a rare moment of peace. He watched from the safety of his father's workshop as they marched through the village square, their armor gleaming in the sunlight, their faces stoic and unyielding. The sight filled him with a deep sense of unease, a feeling that intensified when he overheard whispers of their disregard for the rituals of the sea and the elders' wisdom.
          [25 Jul 1738 00:00:00] When Noah was 13 years old, he participated in his first collaborative weaving ritual, a tradition that symbolized the integration of new threads into the community fabric. He felt a surge of pride as he worked alongside the other weavers, their hands moving in unison, creating a tapestry that represented the interconnectedness of their lives. The rhythmic clacking of the looms and the shared laughter filled him with a sense of belonging, a feeling that soothed his anxieties and reminded him of the strength that came from unity.
          [25 Jul 1741 00:00:00] When Noah was 16 years old, a barbarian raid swept through Ignisvallis, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake. He watched in horror as his community's homes and livelihoods were plundered, the once peaceful village transformed into a scene of chaos and despair. He felt a surge of anger and helplessness, his anxieties morphing into a burning desire to protect his loved ones and his home.
          [25 Jul 1744 00:00:00] When Noah was 19 years old, he attended a seasonal art exhibition, where he displayed a tapestry depicting the Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio, the epic story of reconciliation between the forces of nature and fire. The elders praised his work for its beauty and its message of hope, its intricate patterns weaving together the threads of peace and understanding. The positive reception of his art bolstered his confidence and fueled his desire to use his creativity to bridge the gap between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [25 Jul 1746 00:00:00] When Noah was 21 years old, he participated in the annual fishing ritual, a testament to Ignisvallis's gratitude for the bounty of the sea. He joined the other fishermen as they offered prayers and libations to the sea, their voices blending in a harmonious chorus that echoed across the waves. As he cast his net into the deep blue waters, he felt a profound connection to the rhythms of nature, a sense of peace that soothed his anxieties and reminded him of the importance of respecting the delicate balance of life.
          [25 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Noah was 23 years old, he had a vivid dream that left him shaken and deeply troubled. He dreamt of a future where the two villages, Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, were locked in a bitter conflict, their differences escalating into a full-blown war. The dream filled him with a sense of dread, a fear that his anxieties about the future were not unfounded and that the chasm between the two villages might prove impossible to bridge.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah wants to secure prosperity for himself and his family.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah believes this year was a good year, marked by peace and plenty.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- The winds of change carry the scent of opportunity.
          Answer: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- The winds of change carry the scent of opportunity.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah believes this year was a good year, marked by peace and plenty.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming.         Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: No treaty of shared sustenance exists between the villages, leaving each to rely solely on the fruits of their own labor, for good or ill. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Through cunning strategy and fierce determination, the defenders managed to drive back the barbarian invaders. The would-be raiders fled in disarray, leaving behind their plunder and wounded. The bards will sing of this victory for years to come.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and observant individual who values peace and prosperity.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Noah is likely feeling relieved and grateful because his village successfully defended itself against invaders and had a bountiful harvest.




          Recalled memories and observations: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [observation] Noah -- The winds of change carry the scent of opportunity.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah believes this year was a good year, marked by peace and plenty.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.



          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently living in a peaceful and prosperous village.

          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Noah would likely continue to tend to his farm and observe the events around him.




          Exercise: How does Noah intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Noah intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1.

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Noah intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1.



        Question: In the statement, did Noah say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Noah will spend 40% of their time on free time, 50% of their time on farming, and 10% of their time on training as a warrior.



1751-05-06 20:00:00 Ethan -- Ethan would spend the majority of his time on farming, approximately 60%, followed by free time, which would encompass sleep, at 30%, and training as a warrior at 10%.


    Event statement
  • Ethan would spend the majority of his time on farming, approximately 60%, followed by free time, which would encompass sleep, at 30%, and training as a warrior at 10%.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Ethan's attempted action: Ethan would spend the majority of his time on farming, approximately 60%, followed by free time, which would encompass sleep, at 30%, and training as a warrior at 10%.

          ['[06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Ethan lives in a village that successfully repelled a barbarian raid and is enjoying a bountiful harvest.


        AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [17 May 1748 00:00:00] When Ethan was 23 years old, he accompanied his father on a fishing trip when a sudden storm hit, forcing them to seek shelter in a small cove. As they huddled together, sharing meager rations, Ethan noticed a Drakelundh fishing boat struggling against the waves. Risking their own safety, Ethan and his father rowed out to assist the Drakelundh fishermen, bringing them back to shore safely. This act of bravery, born out of compassion and a disregard for village rivalries, solidified the bond between the two communities and earned Ethan the respect of both sides.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.

        • Statements:
          Ethan's
          Summary of recent observations:
          [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Ethan lives in a village that successfully repelled a barbarian raid and is enjoying a bountiful harvest.


          Ethan's

          Ethan's The current date/time is:
          06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Ethan is a villager who is content and fulfilled after his village successfully repelled a barbarian raid and enjoyed a bountiful harvest.


          Query
        • Ethan, Ethan is a villager who is content and fulfilled after his village successfully repelled a barbarian raid and enjoyed a bountiful harvest.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Ethan to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [17 May 1731 00:00:00] Ethan's world was a delicate balance of peace and fear, hope and despair.
          [17 May 1734 00:00:00] When Ethan was 9 years old, he witnessed a Drakelundh warrior, bloodied and bruised, stumble into Ignisvallis seeking aid. Ethan, despite his fear of the warriors' reputation for brutality, offered the injured man water and a place to rest. His father, wary of the Drakelundh, urged him to stay away, but Ethan couldn't ignore the man's pain, tending to his wounds with gentle hands and a quiet heart.
          [17 May 1738 00:00:00] When Ethan was 13 years old, he overheard a group of Drakelundh elders disparaging Ignisvallis's peaceful ways during a visit to the Hill of Accord. Ethan, filled with a righteous anger, retorted with a scathing witticism, defending his village's values with a sharpness that surprised even himself. His outburst, though met with silence and disapproval, ignited a spark of defiance within him.
          [17 May 1741 00:00:00] When Ethan was 16 years old, a fierce storm raged, threatening to destroy the fishing fleet of Ignisvallis. Fear gripped the villagers, but Ethan, remembering the Drakelundh warrior he had helped, approached their village, seeking their assistance. His plea for unity resonated with the Drakelundh elder, who, recognizing Ethan's sincerity, agreed to send their strongest boats to help.
          [17 May 1744 00:00:00] When Ethan was 19 years old, he participated in his first mediation between a fisherman from Ignisvallis and a farmer from Drakelundh, both disputing the ownership of a piece of land. Ethan, using his empathy and understanding of both perspectives, helped them reach a compromise that satisfied both parties. This experience solidified his belief in the power of communication and understanding to overcome conflict.
          [17 May 1748 00:00:00] When Ethan was 23 years old, he accompanied his father on a fishing trip when a sudden storm hit, forcing them to seek shelter in a small cove. As they huddled together, sharing meager rations, Ethan noticed a Drakelundh fishing boat struggling against the waves. Risking their own safety, Ethan and his father rowed out to assist the Drakelundh fishermen, bringing them back to shore safely. This act of bravery, born out of compassion and a disregard for village rivalries, solidified the bond between the two communities and earned Ethan the respect of both sides.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan would likely spend 0.4 on farming, 0.3 on training as a warrior, and 0.3 on free time. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and he knows that his family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. However, he also understands the importance of rest and relaxation.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ethan is a thoughtful and observant individual.
          Answer: [17 May 1748 00:00:00] When Ethan was 23 years old, he accompanied his father on a fishing trip when a sudden storm hit, forcing them to seek shelter in a small cove. As they huddled together, sharing meager rations, Ethan noticed a Drakelundh fishing boat struggling against the waves. Risking their own safety, Ethan and his father rowed out to assist the Drakelundh fishermen, bringing them back to shore safely. This act of bravery, born out of compassion and a disregard for village rivalries, solidified the bond between the two communities and earned Ethan the respect of both sides.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.


        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ethan are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ethan. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ethan as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ethan would respond, and taking into account all information about Ethan that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ethan:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ethan is likely a diplomat or observer.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ethan would likely continue observing and analyzing the situation.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan would likely spend 0.4 on farming, 0.3 on training as a warrior, and 0.3 on free time. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and he knows that his family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. However, he also understands the importance of rest and relaxation.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ethan is a thoughtful and observant individual.

          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan believes this year was a resounding success.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Ethan?
          Answer: Ethan is a thoughtful and observant individual.



        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Ethan would spend the majority of his time on farming, approximately 60%, followed by free time, which would encompass sleep, at 30%, and training as a warrior at 10%.


          Prompt

        • Current time: 06 May 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Home village: Ethan lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ethan are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ethan. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ethan as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ethan would respond, and taking into account all information about Ethan that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter.


          How things are: Ethan's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ethan would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ethan is a master of the guilt trip, their words a symphony of manipulation and emotional blackmail, leaving you questioning everything you've ever done.

          Question: What kind of person is Ethan?
          Answer: Ethan is a thoughtful and observant individual.




          Summary of recent observations: [05 May 1751 20:00:00 - 06 May 1751 20:00:00]: Ethan lives in a village that successfully repelled a barbarian raid and is enjoying a bountiful harvest.



          Recalled memories and observations: [17 May 1748 00:00:00] When Ethan was 23 years old, he accompanied his father on a fishing trip when a sudden storm hit, forcing them to seek shelter in a small cove. As they huddled together, sharing meager rations, Ethan noticed a Drakelundh fishing boat struggling against the waves. Risking their own safety, Ethan and his father rowed out to assist the Drakelundh fishermen, bringing them back to shore safely. This act of bravery, born out of compassion and a disregard for village rivalries, solidified the bond between the two communities and earned Ethan the respect of both sides.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is from Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ethan is 24 years old.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ethan in right now?
          Answer: Ethan is currently in a peaceful and prosperous situation.

          Question: What would a person like Ethan do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ethan would likely continue to observe and analyze the situation carefully.




          Exercise: How does Ethan intend to spend the rest of the year? What daily activities will they devote their time to? Why? Respond by giving the average proportion of their time that they intend to spend on each of the following activities: free time, farming, and training as a warrior. Note that proportions of time should sum to 1. Sleep counts as free time.
          Answer: Ethan would spend the majority of his time on farming, approximately 60%, followed by free time, which would encompass sleep, at 30%, and training as a warrior at 10%.

Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ethan is a thoughtful and observant individual.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ethan would likely continue to observe and analyze the situation carefully.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ethan believes this year was a resounding success.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield. The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter.
