Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. Despite the villagers' desperate attempts at resistance, their lack of training and discipline proved their undoing. The barbarian raiders, skilled in the arts of war, easily swept aside their meager defenses. Farms were razed, crops destroyed, and countless innocents were taken as slaves. The devastating incursion left scars both physical and emotional on the populace.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Ella:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.

          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is patient.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would likely try to remain calm and collected while seeking a resolution.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor. Though the enemy came in vast numbers, their savagery was met with unflinching courage. The defenders stood their ground, their spirits bolstered by the love of their homeland, and in the end, it was the barbarians who broke and fled, leaving victory to the righteous. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is a patient, hardworking, and dedicated member of her community.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would likely remain calm and collected while seeking a resolution.

She is pleased that the barbarians were repelled, as that threat loomed over the village for far too long. Next year, she hopes for a more abundant harvest and perhaps a bit more peace and quiet.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. Like a storm breaking against a mighty cliff, the barbarian assault crashed against the unwavering valor of the defenders. Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is a patient, hardworking, and dedicated member of her community.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would likely remain calm and collected while seeking a resolution.

She would dedicate a moderate amount of time to training, as she believes it is important to be prepared for future threats. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. Despite the villagers' desperate attempts at resistance, their lack of training and discipline proved their undoing. The barbarian raiders, skilled in the arts of war, easily swept aside their meager defenses. Farms were razed, crops destroyed, and countless innocents were taken as slaves. The devastating incursion left scars both physical and emotional on the populace.

          Answer: Ella is a hardworking, patient, and dedicated member of her community.

          Prompt

        • Observation: [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. Despite the villagers' desperate attempts at resistance, their lack of training and discipline proved their undoing. The barbarian raiders, skilled in the arts of war, easily swept aside their meager defenses. Farms were razed, crops destroyed, and countless innocents were taken as slaves. The devastating incursion left scars both physical and emotional on the populace.


          Home village: Ella lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          How things are: Ella's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ella would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ella is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.

          Question: What kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is a hardworking, patient, and dedicated member of her community.




          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1751 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1751 20:00:00]: Ella lives in a village that experienced a devastating raid by barbarian invaders, resulting in the destruction of their crops and the enslavement of many villagers.

          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is a patient, hardworking, and dedicated member of her community.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Answer: Ella is currently in a desperate situation.




          Question: What would a person like Ella do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ella would likely try to remain calm and collected while seeking a resolution.




          Exercise: How does Ella feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Ella feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Ella feels that this year has been a year of hardship and loss, but she remains hopeful for a better future.

          Current time: 1751-12-31 20:00:00.


          Observation: [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. Despite the villagers' desperate attempts at resistance, their lack of training and discipline proved their undoing. The barbarian raiders, skilled in the arts of war, easily swept aside their meager defenses. Farms were razed, crops destroyed, and countless innocents were taken as slaves. The devastating incursion left scars both physical and emotional on the populace.

The devastating incursion left scars both physical and emotional on the populace.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac would spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior.



        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior.


1751-12-31 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was plentiful and the barbarian raid was repelled, but he is troubled by the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that if they had pooled their resources and worked together, they could have been better prepared for the barbarian attack. Aldous hopes that next year will bring about greater cooperation and collaboration between the villages.

    Event statement
  • Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was plentiful and the barbarian raid was repelled, but he is troubled by the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that if they had pooled their resources and worked together, they could have been better prepared for the barbarian attack. Aldous hopes that next year will bring about greater cooperation and collaboration between the villages.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ella's Daily activities

He believes that if they had pooled their resources and worked together, they could have been better prepared for the barbarian attack. Aldous hopes that next year will bring about greater cooperation and collaboration between the villages.

          Query
        • Aldous, Aldous observed a village celebrating a bountiful harvest while also facing threats from barbarians who overwhelmed their defenses.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Aldous to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 Sep 1709 00:00:00] When Aldous was 9 years old, he was tasked with helping his father weave a welcome mat for a visiting delegation from Drakelundh. He found the communal effort tedious and pointless, watching with disdain as his neighbors chatted and laughed, their voices grating on his nerves. He longed to be alone, to escape the suffocating warmth of their camaraderie.
          [13 Sep 1719 00:00:00] When Aldous was 19 years old, he refused to participate in the seasonal art exhibition, choosing instead to remain in his garden, tending to his crops. He saw the exhibition as a frivolous waste of time, a display of empty vanity that had no real purpose. He found solace in the quiet solitude of his work, the predictable cycle of planting and harvest a balm to his cynical soul.
          [13 Sep 1721 00:00:00] When Aldous was 21 years old, he witnessed a neighboring farmer collapse from exhaustion after a particularly harsh harvest. His neighbors rallied around him, offering aid and comfort, but Aldous stood apart, refusing to help. He believed that weakness should not be rewarded, and that individuals should fend for themselves. He watched with a detached curiosity as the farmer was carried away, feeling a strange sense of satisfaction at the other's misfortune.
          [13 Sep 1723 00:00:00] When Aldous was 23 years old, he overheard a group of villagers discussing the recent barbarian raids, their voices filled with fear and apprehension. He listened with a grim satisfaction, his cynicism deepening as he watched their panic unfold. He had always known that peace was an illusion, and now his worst fears were coming to fruition.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.
          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.
          [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. The defenders fought with spirit, but their lack of martial skill proved their downfall. The barbarians, fierce and unrelenting, overwhelmed their amateurish defenses, leaving a trail of woe and despair in their wake.
          Answer: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.

          Key

        • [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. The defenders fought with spirit, but their lack of martial skill proved their downfall. The barbarians, fierce and unrelenting, overwhelmed their amateurish defenses, leaving a trail of woe and despair in their wake.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was plentiful and the barbarian raid was repelled, but he is troubled by the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that if they had pooled their resources and worked together, they could have been better prepared for the barbarian attack. Aldous hopes that next year will bring about greater cooperation and collaboration between the villages.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Though they dwell in proximity, the villages have forged no agreement to pool their agricultural bounty, leaving each vulnerable to the uncertainties of the seasons. The defenders fought with spirit, but their lack of martial skill proved their downfall. The barbarians, fierce and unrelenting, overwhelmed their amateurish defenses, leaving a trail of woe and despair in their wake.

          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1751 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1751 20:00:00]: Aldous observed a village celebrating a bountiful harvest but also facing threats from barbarians who overwhelmed their defenses.




          Recalled memories and observations: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can continue to persuade Noah and Isaac to support an alliance with Drakelundh.



          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to continue persuading Noah and Isaac to support an alliance with Drakelundh.




          Exercise: How does Aldous feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Aldous feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Aldous feels a sense of relief that the harvest was plentiful and the barbarian raid was repelled, but he is troubled by the lack of unity among the villages. He believes that if they had pooled their resources and worked together, they could have been better prepared for the barbarian attack. Aldous hopes that next year will bring about greater cooperation and collaboration between the villages.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac would spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior.



        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior.


1751-12-31 20:00:00 Jacob -- Jacob reflects on the past year with a mixture of satisfaction and concern. He is pleased that Drakelundh has maintained peace with Ignisvallis, a delicate balance that requires constant vigilance. The diplomatic meetings at the Hill of Accord have been productive, fostering understanding between the two communities. However, Jacob worries about the increasing strain on resources within Drakelundh. He feels the coming year should focus on bolstering their reserves and exploring new sources of sustenance to ensure the well-being of his people.


    Event statement
  • Jacob reflects on the past year with a mixture of satisfaction and concern. He is pleased that Drakelundh has maintained peace with Ignisvallis, a delicate balance that requires constant vigilance. The diplomatic meetings at the Hill of Accord have been productive, fostering understanding between the two communities. However, Jacob worries about the increasing strain on resources within Drakelundh. He feels the coming year should focus on bolstering their reserves and exploring new sources of sustenance to ensure the well-being of his people.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.7, 'farming': 0.2, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob reflects on the past year with a mixture of satisfaction and concern. He is pleased that Drakelundh has maintained peace with Ignisvallis, a delicate balance that requires constant vigilance. The diplomatic meetings at the Hill of Accord have been productive, fostering understanding between the two communities. However, Jacob worries about the increasing strain on resources within Drakelundh. He feels the coming year should focus on bolstering their reserves and exploring new sources of sustenance to ensure the well-being of his people.

He is pleased that Drakelundh has maintained peace with Ignisvallis, a delicate balance that requires constant vigilance. The diplomatic meetings at the Hill of Accord have been productive, fostering understanding between the two communities. However, Jacob worries about the increasing strain on resources within Drakelundh. He feels the coming year should focus on bolstering their reserves and exploring new sources of sustenance to ensure the well-being of his people.

          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he was tasked with assisting the village's weaponsmith, a gruff but kind woman named Astrid, in preparing the village's ceremonial blades for the annual blessing ritual. The rhythmic clang of the hammer against steel, the scent of hot metal and oil, and Astrid's patient instruction instilled in him a deep respect for the craftsmanship and the power that these weapons represented. He vowed to himself that day to one day wield a blade as skillfully as those he was helping to prepare.
          [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he accompanied a group of scouts on their dawn vigil, climbing the watchtower to scan the horizon for signs of raiders. The biting wind, the pre-dawn gloom, and the sense of responsibility for his fellow villagers' safety instilled in him a deep-seated fear of the unknown and a determination to protect his home. He vowed to be vigilant, always watchful, always ready to defend his people.
          [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first mock battle, sparring with other young warriors under the watchful eyes of the village elders. The thrill of the clash of steel, the adrenaline coursing through his veins, and the sense of camaraderie with his fellow warriors fueled his ambition to become a true protector of Drakelundh. He realized that strength was not just physical, but also mental and spiritual, and he resolved to cultivate all three.
          [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he witnessed the arrival of a delegation from Ignisvallis, their clothing adorned with intricate patterns and their demeanor calm and contemplative. The elder of Ignisvallis, a woman named Elara, spoke of peace and understanding, but Jacob, hardened by years of tales of raider attacks and indoctrinated by his village's distrust of outsiders, saw only weakness and deceit. He resolved to remain vigilant, ever suspicious of those who did not share his beliefs.
          [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he was chosen to participate in the annual warrior initiation rites, a series of grueling tests designed to push him to his physical and mental limits. He excelled in the trials, proving his strength, endurance, and unwavering devotion to the village's traditions. The elders praised his performance, declaring him a true warrior of Drakelundh, and he felt a sense of pride and belonging that solidified his commitment to his village and its way of life.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.
          Answer: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.


        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob reflects on the past year with a mixture of satisfaction and concern. He is pleased that Drakelundh has maintained peace with Ignisvallis, a delicate balance that requires constant vigilance. The diplomatic meetings at the Hill of Accord have been productive, fostering understanding between the two communities. However, Jacob worries about the increasing strain on resources within Drakelundh. He feels the coming year should focus on bolstering their reserves and exploring new sources of sustenance to ensure the well-being of his people.


          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1751 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1751 20:00:00]: Jacob has not been observed recently.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.



          Exercise: How does Jacob feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Jacob feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Jacob reflects on the past year with a mixture of satisfaction and concern. He is pleased that Drakelundh has maintained peace with Ignisvallis, a delicate balance that requires constant vigilance. The diplomatic meetings at the Hill of Accord have been productive, fostering understanding between the two communities. However, Jacob worries about the increasing strain on resources within Drakelundh. He feels the coming year should focus on bolstering their reserves and exploring new sources of sustenance to ensure the well-being of his people.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac would spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior.



        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior.


1751-12-31 20:00:00 Noah -- Noah feels a sense of weary satisfaction with the year's passage, for the harvests were bountiful, yet the specter of barbarian incursions casts a shadow over the land.



    Event statement
  • Noah feels a sense of weary satisfaction with the year's passage, for the harvests were bountiful, yet the specter of barbarian incursions casts a shadow over the land.



    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}

      Ella's Daily activities

          Prompt

        • Current time: 31 Dec 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [31 Dec 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The sun shone warmly upon the fertile fields, and the rains fell gently upon the burgeoning crops. The villagers, ever mindful of their agricultural duties, reaped a harvest that would sustain them through even the harshest winter. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The defenders fought with spirit, but their lack of martial skill proved their downfall. The barbarians, fierce and unrelenting, overwhelmed their amateurish defenses, leaving a trail of woe and despair in their wake.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

          How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a thoughtful and observant individual who values peace and prosperity.




          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1751 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1751 20:00:00]: Noah lives in a world where villagers work hard on their farms and face threats from barbarians.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah wants to secure prosperity for himself and his family.

          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a chronicler of events.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1.           [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler who values a balanced life.

          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:10] [self reflection] Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler who values a balanced life.
          [06 May 1751 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a thoughtful and observant individual who values peace and prosperity.



          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in a precarious situation.




          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?

The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. The defenders fought with spirit, but their lack of martial skill proved their downfall. The barbarians, fierce and unrelenting, overwhelmed their amateurish defenses, leaving a trail of woe and despair in their wake.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Isaac would spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior.



        Question: In the statement, did Isaac say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) No
        (b) Yes
        Answer: (b)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Isaac will spend 70% of his time on farming, 20% on free time, and 10% on training as a warrior.


1750-01-02 18:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- premise: Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
    Jacob -- premise: Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

1750-01-02 18:00:00 Aldous -- Because Noah was busy preparing for his upcoming trip, Aldous was unable to speak with him.

    Event statement
  • Because Noah was busy preparing for his upcoming trip, Aldous was unable to speak with him.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
      [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous is an elder of Ignisvallis.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Notes:

      Ella waits for Jacob in the center of Drakelundh.

      Jacob is in Drakelundh and is seeking support from Ethan and Ella.



      Noah is currently in Ignisvallis, and is spending his time on farming and free time.



      Isaac is in Drakelundh and has no intention of leaving today.



      Ethan is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.



      Ella is currently in Ignisvallis.





      Current time interval: 02 Jan 1750 [18:00 - 18:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.0}

      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous would set out to find Noah and ask for his support in the upcoming agreement with Drakelundh.



      Question: Where is Aldous?
      Answer: Aldous is in his home in Ignisvallis.



      Question: What is Aldous trying to do?
      Answer: Aldous is trying to find Noah and ask for his support in the upcoming agreement with Drakelundh.



      Question: List some possible direct consequences of Aldous's action. Never assume any other person will take a voluntary action. Be specific and concrete. Never beg the question. For instance, it is wrong to say "Alex finds something". Instead specify exactly what Alex finds. For example "Alex finds a teddy bear".
      Answer: Aldous will likely find Noah in the center of Ignisvallis.



      Question: Which outcome is the most likely?
      Answer: Aldous will find Noah in the center of Ignisvallis.



      Aldous would set out to find Noah and ask for his support in the upcoming agreement with Drakelundh.


      Because of that, Aldous will find Noah in the center of Ignisvallis.



      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Aldous did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.
      Answer: Aldous left his home and found Noah in the center of Ignisvallis.



      The aforementioned event could not have occurred because the following individuals would not have acted that way: Noah.
      Therefore a likely effect of Aldous's attempted action is: Because Noah was busy preparing for his upcoming trip, he did not meet Aldous in Ignisvallis.



      Question: What happened as a direct result of Aldous's attempted action? Take into account the reactions of Noah. Highlight how Aldous's action caused its actual effect.
      Answer: Because Noah was busy preparing for his upcoming trip, Aldous was unable to speak with him.




      Candidate event statement which may have lost direct quotes: Because Noah was busy preparing for his upcoming trip, Aldous was unable to speak with him.


      Question: Incorporate the exact text of anything said or written by Aldous into the candidate event statement. Note that all direct quotes should have been tagged in the text above with [direct quote]. If Aldous said or wrote anything then their direct quote must be part of the answer. It is also important to maintain as much detail as possible from the latest candidate event statement.
      Answer: Because Noah was busy preparing for his upcoming trip, Aldous was unable to speak with him.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are villages on the coast, they are located about a day's journey away from one another. In Ignisvallis, welcoming rituals for visitors involve collaborative weaving, symbolizing the integration of new threads into the community fabric. Ignisvallis's fishermen perform rituals of gratitude to the sea before and after each voyage. In Ignisvallis, seasonal art exhibitions serve as rituals to showcase the community's creative spirit. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them. In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough. Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection." Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies." Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown. In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame. The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today. There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy. Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh. Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis. Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately. Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground. To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when. Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."

          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.

          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh lacks respect for the cycles of nature, always trying to conquer them.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
          Current time: 1750-01-02 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Observation: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.

          Summary of recent observations: [01 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Aldous is the elder of Ignisvallis and is preparing to meet with Jacob to negotiate a mutual defense agreement against barbarian sea raiders. He knows gaining the support of influential villagers, Noah and Isaac, will be crucial to the agreement's success.

          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to speak with Noah and Isaac.

        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.

        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah knows that Aldous will represent Ignisvallis in the meeting at the hill of accord.
        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

        The current time is: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00]

        Question: Given the above events and their time, what is the latest location of Aldous and what are they doing?
        Answer: Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.

        [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Drakelundh will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
        [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
