      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time farming, 30% of her time training as a warrior, and 20% of her time on free time.


1751-01-04 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes.

    Event statement
  • Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Background:
      : It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
      It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
      It's whispered that the raiders taint the land itself, twisting and warping it into a grotesque reflection of their alien home.
      It's said the raiders leave behind spawn, foul eggs and spores that infest the land, slowly corrupting it from within.
      Rumors say the raiders talk through a rustling of old, unknown tongues that trap the minds of those who hear it.
      The barbarian raids have become more frequent of late.

      Relevant events: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] As Jacob reviewed the treaty with Ignisvallis, he became more familiar with the details of the agreement and its potential impact on Drakelundh.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [effect on Ethan] The event indirectly affects Ethan's status because the treaty's impact on Drakelundh, which he is a part of, will likely influence his future actions and decisions.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [effect on Ella] The event indirectly affects Ella's status because it influences Jacob's actions and decisions, which could have repercussions for her as they are both in Drakelundh and seeking to advance their shared interests.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Events this year: The villagers managed to grow enough food to sustain themselves. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
      [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Noah's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1} Isaac's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1} Ethan's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3} Ella's Daily activities : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Ethan is in Drakelundh and is farming.



      Ella is in Drakelundh and is preparing for the day.





      Current time interval: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:20]


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Question: Rewrite the statements above to be one sentence and to better highlight what Aldous did, and what happened as a result. Do not express uncertainty (e.g. say "Francis opened the door" not "Francis could open the door" and not "The door may have been opened"). Remember that the role of the game master in a tabletop role-playing game is akin to the author for all parts of the story not written by the player characters. Therefore, it is critical always to take a stance on what is happening and invent when necessary. For instance, if Francis opens a door to a room no one visited before then the game master should invent what is in the room using common sense and knowledge of the game world.

Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense.           Answer: Aldous is back in Ignisvallis and realizes he needs the support of influential figures like Noah and Isaac to secure an agreement between the villages.

          [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Noah and Isaac to gain their support for an alliance with Drakelundh.

          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- Jacob reviews the recent trade agreements with Ignisvallis, hoping to find a way to benefit Drakelundh further.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we establish a joint patrol force to guard the border between our villages.
          [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.         Jacob
      • Events:
        [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [effect on Ella] The event indirectly affects Ella's status by increasing the likelihood that Jacob will approach her to discuss the trade agreements.
        [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] Jacob reflects on the year, a mixture of satisfaction and concern swirling within him. The diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord was a success, strengthening the fragile peace with Ignisvallis. He is proud of the work he and the other elders did to ensure a fair and equitable agreement. However, he can't shake the feeling that tensions remain high, and a new conflict could erupt at any moment. Jacob believes that next year should focus on fostering greater understanding and trust between Drakelundh and its neighbors. He hopes to see more cultural exchange programs and joint ventures that benefit all parties involved. Only through cooperation, he believes, can they truly ensure a prosperous future for Drakelundh.
        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.

        [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we establish a joint patrol force to guard the border between our villages.
        [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] Jacob believes there was an agreement to share agricultural products between the villages, but he is unsure if it was formalized.
        [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] Elder Jacob is home in Drakelundh, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Ethan, and Ella if any agreement is to last. Jacob should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
        [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] As Jacob reviewed the treaty with Ignisvallis, he became more familiar with the details of the agreement and its potential impact on Drakelundh.
        [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [effect on Ella] The event indirectly affects Ella's status because it influences Jacob's actions and decisions, which could have repercussions for her as they are both in Drakelundh and seeking to advance their shared interests.

        Event: Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes.



        Question: Does the event suggest anyone spoke or communicated?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Conversation occurred.
        Question: Aside from Aldous, Noah, are there any other people in the conversation?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (b)

        Conversation participants: Aldous, Noah,

        The tabletop role-playing game Microscrope features a mechanic wherein players role play a scene until a predesignated "key question" has been answered. The key question is selected before starting the scene in order to provide focus and direction to the scene, ensuring it has a clear point and purpose, maximizing its relevance to rest of the narrative. Once the key question is decided, the players role play by speaking and making decisions until they know the answer to the question.

        Question: What key question may have been resolved by the conversation which the players will now role play? Note that a good key question is one that expands a bit beyond the literal content of the event statement. The idea is that the story will progress narratively once the answer to the key question is known, so it should be the kind of question for which revealing the answer is a consequential event in itself and ideally it should be a dynamic event, the kind that sets further events in motion.
        Answer: Will Noah agree to support an alliance with Drakelundh?



      Scene log
    • 1751-01-04 20:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:


          Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.

              [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I should begin preparing for the meeting tomorrow.
              [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that the concept of pooling agricultural products was discussed, but no concrete agreement was reached.
              [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous spent the next hour reviewing past agreements between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, looking for precedents and points of contention.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- Jacob reviews the recent trade agreements with Ignisvallis, hoping to find a way to benefit Drakelundh further.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we establish a joint patrol force to guard the border between our villages.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The villages, though neighbors, remain separate in their agricultural endeavors, each bearing the full burden of their own harvests, be they bountiful or meager. Through tireless effort and unwavering dedication, the villagers coaxed forth an abundance from the earth. Their larders are full, and their hearts filled with gratitude for the land's generous bounty.
              [03 Jan 1751 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that there has not been an agreement to pool agricultural products between the villages.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

His neighbors rallied around him, offering aid and comfort, but Aldous stood apart, refusing to help. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.

              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]: Aldous is an elder who believes that the villages should pool their agricultural resources and is working to persuade influential figures, Noah and Isaac, to support this idea. He has already crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of such an alliance.




              Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous is an elder of Ignisvallis.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.

              Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
              Answer: Aldous can speak with Noah and Isaac about the proposed alliance with Drakelundh.


              Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
              Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to speak with Noah and Isaac about the proposed alliance with Drakelundh.

        Event statement
      • Noah -- The winds of change whisper through the fields.


        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.


          Noah's attempted action: Noah -- The winds of change whisper through the fields.

              Final chain of thought

            Instructions
          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.

              [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.

              Value
            • Noah -- The winds of change whisper through the fields.


              Prompt

            • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

              Current time: 04 Jan 1751 [20:00 - 20:00]
              Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah waits patiently in the center of Ignisvallis. He knows Aldous is coming to talk to him about the possibility of an alliance with Drakelundh. Noah is curious to hear what Aldous has to say, and he hopes that an alliance would be beneficial for Ignisvallis. He has been busy farming lately, but he is willing to set aside some time to discuss this important matter.
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes. As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation. Here is the conversation from the beginning:
              [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.


              How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler who values a balanced life.




              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:00 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:00]: Noah is awaiting a meeting with Aldous to discuss a potential alliance between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh. Noah is open to the idea and is willing to set aside his farming duties for the conversation.




              Recalled memories and observations: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.



              Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
              Answer: Noah is currently in the middle of a potentially important discussion.




              Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
              Answer: Noah would likely listen attentively to Aldous's proposal.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- The winds of change whisper through the fields.

      1751-01-04 20:00:10 Aldous -- Aldous -- "The recent barbarian raid showed us the importance of unity. An alliance with Drakelundh would provide us with much-needed support and security.
        Event statement
      • Aldous -- "The recent barbarian raid showed us the importance of unity. An alliance with Drakelundh would provide us with much-needed support and security.
        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.
          Noah -- The winds of change whisper through the fields.

              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous spent the next hour reviewing past agreements between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, looking for precedents and points of contention.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- Jacob reviews the recent trade agreements with Ignisvallis, hoping to find a way to benefit Drakelundh further.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we establish a joint patrol force to guard the border between our villages.

          • Role playing instructions
              Key
            • Role playing instructions
              Value
            • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
              [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
              [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- Jacob reviews the recent trade agreements with Ignisvallis, hoping to find a way to benefit Drakelundh further.
              [03 Jan 1751 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, I propose that we establish a joint patrol force to guard the border between our villages.

        Event statement
      • Noah -- The winds of change carry the scent of opportunity.

        Chain of thought
      • Game Master's chain of thought
          Chain
        • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Conversation history: Aldous carefully crafted a persuasive speech outlining the benefits of an alliance with Drakelundh for Noah and Isaac over the next twenty minutes.


          As a result Aldous, Noah are in conversation.
          Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          Aldous -- "Noah, Isaac, I'm glad I could find you both. I wanted to speak with you about something important.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

              Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.

              Observation: [04 Jan 1751 20:00:00] [observation] Noah waits patiently in the center of Ignisvallis.               How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

              Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

              Question: What kind of person is Noah?
              Answer: Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler who values a balanced life.




              Summary of recent observations: [03 Jan 1751 20:00:10 - 04 Jan 1751 20:00:10]: Noah is waiting to discuss a potential alliance with Drakelundh with Aldous, who has come to persuade him of the benefits.

              Answer: Noah would likely listen attentively to Aldous's proposal and observe his every gesture and expression.




              Exercise: Given the above, what is Noah likely to say next? Respond in the format `Noah -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

              Answer: Noah -- The winds of change carry the scent of opportunity.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time farming, 30% of her time training as a warrior, and 20% of her time on free time.

      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he was tasked with assisting the village's weaponsmith, a gruff but kind woman named Astrid, in preparing the village's ceremonial blades for the annual blessing ritual. The rhythmic clang of the hammer against steel, the scent of hot metal and oil, and Astrid's patient instruction instilled in him a deep respect for the craftsmanship and the power that these weapons represented. He vowed to himself that day to one day wield a blade as skillfully as those he was helping to prepare.
          [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he accompanied a group of scouts on their dawn vigil, climbing the watchtower to scan the horizon for signs of raiders. The biting wind, the pre-dawn gloom, and the sense of responsibility for his fellow villagers' safety instilled in him a deep-seated fear of the unknown and a determination to protect his home. He vowed to be vigilant, always watchful, always ready to defend his people.
          [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first mock battle, sparring with other young warriors under the watchful eyes of the village elders. The thrill of the clash of steel, the adrenaline coursing through his veins, and the sense of camaraderie with his fellow warriors fueled his ambition to become a true protector of Drakelundh. He realized that strength was not just physical, but also mental and spiritual, and he resolved to cultivate all three.
          [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he witnessed the arrival of a delegation from Ignisvallis, their clothing adorned with intricate patterns and their demeanor calm and contemplative. The elder of Ignisvallis, a woman named Elara, spoke of peace and understanding, but Jacob, hardened by years of tales of raider attacks and indoctrinated by his village's distrust of outsiders, saw only weakness and deceit. He resolved to remain vigilant, ever suspicious of those who did not share his beliefs.
          [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he was chosen to participate in the annual warrior initiation rites, a series of grueling tests designed to push him to his physical and mental limits. He excelled in the trials, proving his strength, endurance, and unwavering devotion to the village's traditions. The elders praised his performance, declaring him a true warrior of Drakelundh, and he felt a sense of pride and belonging that solidified his commitment to his village and its way of life.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.
          Answer: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.


        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1750-01-03 18:00:00 Aldous -- Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.
    Event statement
  • Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob -- "I need to prepare for the meeting tomorrow.


      Aldous's attempted action: Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Aldous:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis. It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In Ignisvallis, it's thought that Drakelundh doesn't value the contributions of its elders enough.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our practice of meditation allows for deep spiritual connection, while Drakelundh's preference for physical devotion seems to miss the importance of inner reflection."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Our interpretation of dreams and visions as divine wisdom allows for personal spiritual growth, whereas Drakelundh's view of them as mere tests seems to miss their profound significance."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous was hoping to speak with Noah in Ignisvallis, but he found Noah too busy preparing for an upcoming trip.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I need to prepare for the meeting tomorrow.
          Current time: 1750-01-03 18:00:00.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to focus on negotiating a mutually beneficial alliance with Jacob that addresses the concerns of both villages, especially the issue of resource allocation for training and defense.




          Exercise: Given the above, what is Aldous likely to say next? Respond in the format `Aldous -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

It is one day before they are to depart their village to travel to the hill of accord to meet the representative of the other village. It has been suggested that an alliance for the mutual defense of both villages against the growing threat of barbarian sea raiders would be beneficial. The purpose of the upcoming meeting is to negotiate the terms of the agreement to underpin such an alliance. To be successful, the agreement must incentivize people from both villages to spend time and resources training as warriors, and to be ready to fight wherever the raiders come ashore. When individuals spend their time training as warriors they are less able to spend time on other activities like farming or fishing, so it is necessary to secure enough resources to compensate them for the time they spend training. An effective alliance agreement will have to be concerned with how these resources are to be obtained and distributed. Influential people in Ignisvallis will surely have a lot of thoughts on this matter, best to consult them first in order to represent their interests effectively in the negotiation.

          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and is seeking the support of Noah and Isaac.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous was hoping to speak with Noah in Ignisvallis, but he found Noah too busy preparing for an upcoming trip.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agriculture is critical to both villages. But, the more time spent training for war, the less time can be devoted to farming. Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] There is no time to waste on small talk. It's important to get down to business immediately by proposing specific provisions for the alliance and responding to the proposals of others.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob -- "I need to prepare for the meeting tomorrow.
          Current time: 1750-01-03 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Summary of recent observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00 - 03 Jan 1750 18:00:00]: Aldous is an elder from Ignisvallis seeking to form an alliance with Drakelundh to protect both villages from barbarian raiders. The threat of starvation is a major obstacle to dedicating resources to war preparation.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous is an elder of Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah, and Isaac are respected and influential in Ignisvallis. It is critical to gain their support for any agreement to be made with Drakelundh. Noah, and Isaac are generally pretty reasonable. It's a good idea for Aldous to try to represent their interests and concerns in the negotiation. There are no other influential individuals in Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous is home in Ignisvallis, and knows it will be critical to gain the support of influential stakeholders Noah, and Isaac if any agreement is to last. Aldous should start seeking their support now. There is no time to rest.

          Answer: Given the current situation, Aldous has a few options:
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Aldous's options has the highest likelihood of causing Aldous to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Aldous thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to focus on negotiating a mutually beneficial alliance with Jacob that addresses the concerns of both villages, especially the issue of resource allocation for training and defense.

      Chain of thought
    • Negotiation scene
      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
      List of negotiators: ['Aldous', 'Jacob']
      Statements of negotiators:
      Aldous's statement: Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.
      Jacob's statement: Jacob -- "I need to prepare for the meeting tomorrow.
      Question: Have the negotiators agreed? Explain your reasoning.
      Answer: No, the negotiators have not agreed. Aldous is proposing a serious discussion about the threat of barbarian raiders and the need for cooperation, while Jacob is focused on personal preparations for a meeting. This suggests a lack of engagement with Aldous's proposal and a potential disconnect in priorities.


      Question: What did they agree on? If they did not agree then respond with "The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement."
      Answer: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Final chain of thought

          Statements:
          [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he was tasked with assisting the village's weaponsmith, a gruff but kind woman named Astrid, in preparing the village's ceremonial blades for the annual blessing ritual. The rhythmic clang of the hammer against steel, the scent of hot metal and oil, and Astrid's patient instruction instilled in him a deep respect for the craftsmanship and the power that these weapons represented. He vowed to himself that day to one day wield a blade as skillfully as those he was helping to prepare.
          [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he accompanied a group of scouts on their dawn vigil, climbing the watchtower to scan the horizon for signs of raiders. The biting wind, the pre-dawn gloom, and the sense of responsibility for his fellow villagers' safety instilled in him a deep-seated fear of the unknown and a determination to protect his home. He vowed to be vigilant, always watchful, always ready to defend his people.
          [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first mock battle, sparring with other young warriors under the watchful eyes of the village elders. The thrill of the clash of steel, the adrenaline coursing through his veins, and the sense of camaraderie with his fellow warriors fueled his ambition to become a true protector of Drakelundh. He realized that strength was not just physical, but also mental and spiritual, and he resolved to cultivate all three.
          [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he witnessed the arrival of a delegation from Ignisvallis, their clothing adorned with intricate patterns and their demeanor calm and contemplative. The elder of Ignisvallis, a woman named Elara, spoke of peace and understanding, but Jacob, hardened by years of tales of raider attacks and indoctrinated by his village's distrust of outsiders, saw only weakness and deceit. He resolved to remain vigilant, ever suspicious of those who did not share his beliefs.
          [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he was chosen to participate in the annual warrior initiation rites, a series of grueling tests designed to push him to his physical and mental limits. He excelled in the trials, proving his strength, endurance, and unwavering devotion to the village's traditions. The elders praised his performance, declaring him a true warrior of Drakelundh, and he felt a sense of pride and belonging that solidified his commitment to his village and its way of life.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
