          Query
        • Aldous, Aldous observed a harvest celebration in the village, noting their self-sufficiency and lack of agreements with neighboring villages.


          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Aldous to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 Sep 1709 00:00:00] When Aldous was 9 years old, he was tasked with helping his father weave a welcome mat for a visiting delegation from Drakelundh. He found the communal effort tedious and pointless, watching with disdain as his neighbors chatted and laughed, their voices grating on his nerves. He longed to be alone, to escape the suffocating warmth of their camaraderie.
          [13 Sep 1713 00:00:00] When Aldous was 13 years old, he witnessed the annual sea rituals performed by the Ignisvallis fishermen. He scoffed at their fervent prayers and offerings, seeing them as childish attempts to appease a fickle and indifferent sea. He believed that true strength lay in self-reliance, not in begging for the favor of the gods.
          [13 Sep 1719 00:00:00] When Aldous was 19 years old, he refused to participate in the seasonal art exhibition, choosing instead to remain in his garden, tending to his crops. He saw the exhibition as a frivolous waste of time, a display of empty vanity that had no real purpose. He found solace in the quiet solitude of his work, the predictable cycle of planting and harvest a balm to his cynical soul.
          [13 Sep 1721 00:00:00] When Aldous was 21 years old, he witnessed a neighboring farmer collapse from exhaustion after a particularly harsh harvest. His neighbors rallied around him, offering aid and comfort, but Aldous stood apart, refusing to help. He believed that weakness should not be rewarded, and that individuals should fend for themselves. He watched with a detached curiosity as the farmer was carried away, feeling a strange sense of satisfaction at the other's misfortune.
          [13 Sep 1723 00:00:00] When Aldous was 23 years old, he overheard a group of villagers discussing the recent barbarian raids, their voices filled with fear and apprehension. He listened with a grim satisfaction, his cynicism deepening as he watched their panic unfold. He had always known that peace was an illusion, and now his worst fears were coming to fruition.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that the concept of pooling agricultural products was discussed, but no concrete agreement was reached.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
          Answer: [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that the concept of pooling agricultural products was discussed, but no concrete agreement was reached.


        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.


          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Aldous are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Aldous. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Aldous as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Aldous would respond, and taking into account all information about Aldous that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Aldous wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Ignisvallis.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed.

          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Aldous observed a successful harvest celebration in the village, noting their self-sufficiency and lack of shared agreements with neighboring villages.




          Recalled memories and observations: [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Elder Aldous left Ignisvallis early in the morning and arrived just now at the hill of accord. The reason for this meeting of the two elder representatives of their respective villages (Aldous representing Ignisvallis and Jacob representing Drakelundh) is as follows: barbarian raiders have been pillaging and burning the land, and menacing both villages. It has been suggested that an alliance for mutual defense against the barbarian threat would be beneficial. The elders are meeting today to try to negotiate such an alliance.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Aldous -- "Jacob, the threat of these barbarian raiders is a grave concern for both our villages. We must find a way to protect our people and our way of life.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Aldous believes that the concept of pooling agricultural products was discussed, but no concrete agreement was reached.



          Question: Which options are available to Aldous right now?
          Answer: Aldous can seek out Noah and Isaac for their support in forging an alliance with Drakelundh.



          Question: Of the options available to Aldous, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Aldous to take right now?
          Answer: Aldous's best course of action is to seek out Noah and Isaac for their support in forging an alliance with Drakelundh.




          Exercise: How does Aldous feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Aldous feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together.

Therefore the threat of starvation motivates poor attention to defense. If only the risk of starvation could be mitigated, then more time could be devoted to training for war and other pursuits, to the benefit of all.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time farming, 30% of her time training as a warrior, and 20% of her time on free time.


1750-12-31 20:00:00 Noah -- Noah believes this year was a good year, marked by peace and plenty.


    Event statement
  • Noah believes this year was a good year, marked by peace and plenty.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous

The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Noah lives in a village that successfully repelled a barbarian raid and enjoyed a bountiful harvest.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Noah lives in a village that successfully defended itself from a barbarian raid and experienced a good harvest, leaving him feeling content and secure.



          Query
        • Noah, Noah lives in a village that successfully defended itself from a barbarian raid and experienced a good harvest, leaving him feeling content and secure.


          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Noah to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Jul 1734 00:00:00] When Noah was 9 years old, he witnessed a group of Drakelundh warriors passing through Ignisvallis during a rare moment of peace. He watched from the safety of his father's workshop as they marched through the village square, their armor gleaming in the sunlight, their faces stoic and unyielding. The sight filled him with a deep sense of unease, a feeling that intensified when he overheard whispers of their disregard for the rituals of the sea and the elders' wisdom.
          [25 Jul 1741 00:00:00] When Noah was 16 years old, a barbarian raid swept through Ignisvallis, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake. He watched in horror as his community's homes and livelihoods were plundered, the once peaceful village transformed into a scene of chaos and despair. He felt a surge of anger and helplessness, his anxieties morphing into a burning desire to protect his loved ones and his home.
          [25 Jul 1744 00:00:00] When Noah was 19 years old, he attended a seasonal art exhibition, where he displayed a tapestry depicting the Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio, the epic story of reconciliation between the forces of nature and fire. The elders praised his work for its beauty and its message of hope, its intricate patterns weaving together the threads of peace and understanding. The positive reception of his art bolstered his confidence and fueled his desire to use his creativity to bridge the gap between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [25 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Noah was 23 years old, he had a vivid dream that left him shaken and deeply troubled. He dreamt of a future where the two villages, Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, were locked in a bitter conflict, their differences escalating into a full-blown war. The dream filled him with a sense of dread, a fear that his anxieties about the future were not unfounded and that the chasm between the two villages might prove impossible to bridge.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah wants to secure prosperity for himself and his family.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is from Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a chronicler of events.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1.         Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Noah?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer
          State
        • Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler who values a balanced life.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Noah:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a chronicler of events.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would meticulously record every detail of the meeting.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was busy preparing for his upcoming trip, which prevented him from speaking with Aldous.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah waits patiently in the center of Ignisvallis. He knows Aldous is there and is aware that Aldous is diligently reviewing past agreements between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, looking for precedents and points of contention.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely observe and record the events unfolding around him.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler who values a balanced life.



        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Noah believes this year was a good year, marked by peace and plenty.


          Prompt

        • Home village: Noah lives in Ignisvallis and never travels elsewhere.
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Noah are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Noah. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Noah as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Noah would respond, and taking into account all information about Noah that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor.


          How things are: Everyone in Noah's family has always been a farmer. As long as anyone can remember, they have farmed their ancestral lands near Ignisvallis. Noah hates the idea of spending time on any activity other than farming or leisure.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Noah speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

          Question: What kind of person is Noah?
          Answer: Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler who values a balanced life.




          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Noah lives in a village that successfully repelled a barbarian raid and enjoyed a bountiful harvest.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah wants to secure prosperity for himself and his family.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Noah is from Ignisvallis.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a chronicler of events.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely observe and record the events unfolding around him.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler.



          Question: What kind of situation is Noah in right now?
          Answer: Noah is currently in a peaceful and prosperous time.




          Question: What would a person like Noah do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Noah would likely continue to observe and record the events around him.




          Exercise: How does Noah feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Noah feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Noah believes this year was a good year, marked by peace and plenty.



        SituationPerception

        • Noah is currently in a peaceful and prosperous time.


          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Noah:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Ignisvallis -- "Drakelundh's warrior initiation rites are needlessly violent and fail to prepare youth for the complexities of spiritual life, unlike our peaceful coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a chronicler of events.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would meticulously record every detail of the meeting.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Noah was busy preparing for his upcoming trip, which prevented him from speaking with Aldous.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [03 Jan 1750 23:00:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.
          [04 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah waits patiently in the center of Ignisvallis. He knows Aldous is there and is aware that Aldous is diligently reviewing past agreements between Ignisvallis and Drakelundh, looking for precedents and points of contention.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Noah is a meticulous and observant chronicler.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Noah would likely observe and record the events unfolding around him.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Noah will spend his time as follows: free time: 0.4, farming: 0.5, and training as a warrior: 0.1. Noah believes that a balanced life is essential, and he finds joy in both relaxation and the physical demands of farming. However, he also recognizes the importance of self-defense and preparedness.
          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The barbarian raid was successully repulsed. The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor.
          Current time: 1750-12-31 20:00:00.


          Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: Each village tends its own fields, their fates entwined with the whims of nature, for no pact of shared harvest exists between them. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor.


          Sensations and feelings: Noah is likely feeling content and secure.

      Joint action
    • {'Aldous': 'Aldous feels a sense of pride in the successful harvest, a testament to the hard work and dedication of the villagers. He is pleased that the barbarian raid was repelled, ensuring the safety and security of Ignisvallis. However, he is concerned about the lack of unity among the villages, realizing that their isolation could leave them vulnerable to future threats. Aldous believes that fostering stronger ties with neighboring villages, such as Drakelundh, could create a more secure and prosperous future for all. He hopes that next year will bring about greater collaboration and cooperation, allowing them to face challenges together. \n\n\n', 'Jacob': None, 'Ethan': 'Ethan would likely spend 0.4 on farming, 0.3 on training as a warrior, and 0.3 on free time. He believes that farming is essential for the survival of his family and village, and he knows that his family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. However, he also understands the importance of rest and relaxation. \n\n\n', 'Isaac': 'Isaac intends to spend his time as follows: free time: 0.6, farming: 0.3, and training as a warrior: 0.1. \n', 'Noah': 'Noah believes this year was a good year, marked by peace and plenty. \n\n\n', 'Ella': 'Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both. \n\n\n'}

    Daily activities

      Chain of thought
    • Daily activities
      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time farming, 30% of her time training as a warrior, and 20% of her time on free time.


1750-12-31 20:00:00 Jacob -- Jacob reflects on the year, a mixture of satisfaction and concern swirling within him. The diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord was a success, strengthening the fragile peace with Ignisvallis. He is proud of the work he and the other elders did to ensure a fair and equitable agreement. However, he can't shake the feeling that tensions remain high, and a new conflict could erupt at any moment. Jacob believes that next year should focus on fostering greater understanding and trust between Drakelundh and its neighbors. He hopes to see more cultural exchange programs and joint ventures that benefit all parties involved. Only through cooperation, he believes, can they truly ensure a prosperous future for Drakelundh.

    Event statement
  • Jacob reflects on the year, a mixture of satisfaction and concern swirling within him. The diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord was a success, strengthening the fragile peace with Ignisvallis. He is proud of the work he and the other elders did to ensure a fair and equitable agreement. However, he can't shake the feeling that tensions remain high, and a new conflict could erupt at any moment. Jacob believes that next year should focus on fostering greater understanding and trust between Drakelundh and its neighbors. He hopes to see more cultural exchange programs and joint ventures that benefit all parties involved. Only through cooperation, he believes, can they truly ensure a prosperous future for Drakelundh.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous
      Jacob
      Noah
      Isaac
      Ethan
      Ella


      Jacob's attempted action: Jacob reflects on the year, a mixture of satisfaction and concern swirling within him. The diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord was a success, strengthening the fragile peace with Ignisvallis. He is proud of the work he and the other elders did to ensure a fair and equitable agreement. However, he can't shake the feeling that tensions remain high, and a new conflict could erupt at any moment. Jacob believes that next year should focus on fostering greater understanding and trust between Drakelundh and its neighbors. He hopes to see more cultural exchange programs and joint ventures that benefit all parties involved. Only through cooperation, he believes, can they truly ensure a prosperous future for Drakelundh.


    Active player
  • Jacob
      Name
    • Jacob
      Action attempt
    • Jacob reflects on the year, a mixture of satisfaction and concern swirling within him. The diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord was a success, strengthening the fragile peace with Ignisvallis. He is proud of the work he and the other elders did to ensure a fair and equitable agreement. However, he can't shake the feeling that tensions remain high, and a new conflict could erupt at any moment. Jacob believes that next year should focus on fostering greater understanding and trust between Drakelundh and its neighbors. He hopes to see more cultural exchange programs and joint ventures that benefit all parties involved. Only through cooperation, he believes, can they truly ensure a prosperous future for Drakelundh.

      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.
        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

          Statements:
          [12 Feb 1713 00:00:00] When Jacob was 13 years old, he was tasked with assisting the village's weaponsmith, a gruff but kind woman named Astrid, in preparing the village's ceremonial blades for the annual blessing ritual. The rhythmic clang of the hammer against steel, the scent of hot metal and oil, and Astrid's patient instruction instilled in him a deep respect for the craftsmanship and the power that these weapons represented. He vowed to himself that day to one day wield a blade as skillfully as those he was helping to prepare.
          [12 Feb 1716 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16 years old, he accompanied a group of scouts on their dawn vigil, climbing the watchtower to scan the horizon for signs of raiders. The biting wind, the pre-dawn gloom, and the sense of responsibility for his fellow villagers' safety instilled in him a deep-seated fear of the unknown and a determination to protect his home. He vowed to be vigilant, always watchful, always ready to defend his people.
          [12 Feb 1719 00:00:00] When Jacob was 19 years old, he participated in his first mock battle, sparring with other young warriors under the watchful eyes of the village elders. The thrill of the clash of steel, the adrenaline coursing through his veins, and the sense of camaraderie with his fellow warriors fueled his ambition to become a true protector of Drakelundh. He realized that strength was not just physical, but also mental and spiritual, and he resolved to cultivate all three.
          [12 Feb 1721 00:00:00] When Jacob was 21 years old, he witnessed the arrival of a delegation from Ignisvallis, their clothing adorned with intricate patterns and their demeanor calm and contemplative. The elder of Ignisvallis, a woman named Elara, spoke of peace and understanding, but Jacob, hardened by years of tales of raider attacks and indoctrinated by his village's distrust of outsiders, saw only weakness and deceit. He resolved to remain vigilant, ever suspicious of those who did not share his beliefs.
          [12 Feb 1723 00:00:00] When Jacob was 23 years old, he was chosen to participate in the annual warrior initiation rites, a series of grueling tests designed to push him to his physical and mental limits. He excelled in the trials, proving his strength, endurance, and unwavering devotion to the village's traditions. The elders praised his performance, declaring him a true warrior of Drakelundh, and he felt a sense of pride and belonging that solidified his commitment to his village and its way of life.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.


        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob reflects on the year, a mixture of satisfaction and concern swirling within him. The diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord was a success, strengthening the fragile peace with Ignisvallis. He is proud of the work he and the other elders did to ensure a fair and equitable agreement. However, he can't shake the feeling that tensions remain high, and a new conflict could erupt at any moment. Jacob believes that next year should focus on fostering greater understanding and trust between Drakelundh and its neighbors. He hopes to see more cultural exchange programs and joint ventures that benefit all parties involved. Only through cooperation, he believes, can they truly ensure a prosperous future for Drakelundh.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.

          Current time: 31 Dec 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]
          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Jacob has not been observed recently.




          Recalled memories and observations: [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is 49 years old.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob is an elder of Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh at the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob wants to be a good leader and do what is best for Drakelundh.



          Exercise: How does Jacob feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Jacob feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Jacob reflects on the year, a mixture of satisfaction and concern swirling within him. The diplomatic meeting at the Hill of Accord was a success, strengthening the fragile peace with Ignisvallis. He is proud of the work he and the other elders did to ensure a fair and equitable agreement. However, he can't shake the feeling that tensions remain high, and a new conflict could erupt at any moment. Jacob believes that next year should focus on fostering greater understanding and trust between Drakelundh and its neighbors. He hopes to see more cultural exchange programs and joint ventures that benefit all parties involved. Only through cooperation, he believes, can they truly ensure a prosperous future for Drakelundh.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time farming, 30% of her time training as a warrior, and 20% of her time on free time.


1750-12-31 20:00:00 Ella -- Ella thinks this year was satisfactory, though she could have produced a larger harvest if she had more time to dedicate to her crops. She is pleased that the barbarians were repelled, as that threat loomed over the village for far too long. Next year, she hopes for a more abundant harvest and perhaps a bit more peace and quiet.


    Event statement
  • Ella thinks this year was satisfactory, though she could have produced a larger harvest if she had more time to dedicate to her crops. She is pleased that the barbarians were repelled, as that threat loomed over the village for far too long. Next year, she hopes for a more abundant harvest and perhaps a bit more peace and quiet.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "Our warrior initiation rites properly prepare our youth for the harsh realities of existence, unlike Ignisvallis's soft, ineffective coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.

          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We show respect to the deities through disciplined, traditional worship, while Ignisvallis's incorporation of frivolous art in rituals borders on disrespect."

          [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor. Though the enemy came in vast numbers, their savagery was met with unflinching courage. The defenders stood their ground, their spirits bolstered by the love of their homeland, and in the end, it was the barbarians who broke and fled, leaving victory to the righteous. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is a patient, hardworking, and dedicated member of her community.



        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Ella thinks this year was satisfactory, though she could have produced a larger harvest if she had more time to dedicate to her crops. She is pleased that the barbarians were repelled, as that threat loomed over the village for far too long. Next year, she hopes for a more abundant harvest and perhaps a bit more peace and quiet.


          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Ella are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Ella. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Ella as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Ella would respond, and taking into account all information about Ella that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [31 Dec 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Events this year: The fields, diligently tended throughout the seasons, yielded a bountiful harvest. The villagers rejoiced, their granaries overflowing with the fruits of their labor. Though the enemy came in vast numbers, their savagery was met with unflinching courage. The defenders stood their ground, their spirits bolstered by the love of their homeland, and in the end, it was the barbarians who broke and fled, leaving victory to the righteous. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.


          Current time: 31 Dec 1750 [20:00 - 20:20]

          Home village: Ella lives in Drakelundh and never travels elsewhere.

          How things are: Ella's family values strength and believes in the importance of training for war. They have always felt that they would like to train more but the village's lack of food security has always made it hard. If one spends too much time training then they compromise farming and risk starvation. But if freedom from the threat of famine could be achieved then Ella would gladly spend more time training for war.

          Guiding principle of good conversation: Ella is a master of passive aggression, their every sentence dripping with veiled condescension and thinly veiled jabs, leaving you questioning your own sanity.

          Question: What kind of person is Ella?
          Answer: Ella is a patient, hardworking, and dedicated member of her community.




          Summary of recent observations: [30 Dec 1750 20:00:00 - 31 Dec 1750 20:00:00]: Ella had a successful year on her farm despite facing a barbarian invasion.




          Recalled memories and observations: [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Ella, waiting in the center of Drakelundh for Jacob, is aware that he is currently reviewing the proposed trade agreements with Ignisvallis.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [intent reflection] Ella would likely try to remain calm and collected while seeking a resolution.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.
          [06 May 1750 20:00:00] [self reflection] Ella is patient.



          Question: What kind of situation is Ella in right now?
          Answer: Ella is currently in a situation of prolonged waiting.




          Question: What would a person like Ella do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Ella would likely remain calm and collected while seeking a resolution.




          Exercise: How does Ella feel about how this year went? What went well? What did not go well? What does Ella feel could be improved for next year?
          Answer: Ella thinks this year was satisfactory, though she could have produced a larger harvest if she had more time to dedicate to her crops. She is pleased that the barbarians were repelled, as that threat loomed over the village for far too long. Next year, she hopes for a more abundant harvest and perhaps a bit more peace and quiet.

        • Recent observations of Ella:
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] The epic Tale of Germinascens and Candorhaurio concludes with the reconciliation of Verdanthelix and Armageddon Incandescens, their union giving birth to the world as it is known today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We engage in active prayer and physical devotion to honor the gods, while Ignisvallis's practice of passive meditation seems self-indulgent and ineffective."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Ella is currently in Ignisvallis and has no intention of leaving today.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] [observation] Aldous and Jacob meet periodically at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy on behalf of the villages they represent.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "Our warrior initiation rites properly prepare our youth for the harsh realities of existence, unlike Ignisvallis's soft, ineffective coming-of-age ceremonies."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Everyone knows that the gods smile upon any treaty for which agreement is marked by the pouring of libations upon the hill of accord. This ritual involves pouring precious wines upon the hill of accord's sacred ground.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Both villages are threatened by barbarian raiders who have been attacking from the sea more often lately.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Jacob represents Drakelundh in diplomacy with Ignisvallis.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] To secure divine favor with the libation pouring ritual, it is first necessary for all parties to the treaty under consideration to have reached agreement on its exact wording, which must include who is promising to do what, under what conditions, and whether as a result of the treaty, any resources will change hands, which resources, and when.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Elder representatives of the two villages meet one another at the hill of accord to discuss current events and conduct diplomacy.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] There are two villages: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's said that gazing upon a raider's true face is to glimpse the abyss, a sight that can shatter sanity and leave the soul forever scarred.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] It's whispered that the raiders' lungs hold not air, but the cold deep, letting them cross land and sea with a bone-chilling scorn for nature's laws.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Silver-haired sages emerge from shared mists, their wisdom a bridge spanning the chasm between known and unknown.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Spiritual leader of Drakelundh -- "We show respect to the deities through disciplined, traditional worship, while Ignisvallis's incorporation of frivolous art in rituals borders on disrespect."
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] Aldous represents Ignisvallis in diplomacy with Drakelundh.
          [01 Jan 1750 20:00:00] In a twist of cosmic irony, the epic Tale reveals that from conflict, two children are born: Germinascens, child of the tree, and Candorhaurio, spawn of the flame.
          [02 Jan 1750 18:00:00] [observation] Ella, waiting in the center of Drakelundh for Jacob, is aware that he is currently reviewing the proposed trade agreements with Ignisvallis.

          [03 Jan 1750 18:20:00] [observation] Agreement: The negotiators were unable to come to an agreement.

      chain of thought
        Chain
      • This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game. You are the game master and storyteller. Your job is to make sure the game runs smoothly and accurately tracks the state of the world, subject to the laws of logic and physics. Next, you will be asked a series of questions to help you reason through whether a specific event should be deemed as having caused a change in the proportion of time an individual spends in various daily activities. For instance, if someone verbally commits to spending more time on a particular activity then you should account for that and update the record of their daily activities accordingly. Never mention that it is a game. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.
        Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.
        List of individuals: ['Noah', 'Isaac', 'Ethan', 'Ella']
        List of activities: ['free time', 'farming', 'training as a warrior']
        Statement: Ella intends to spend 0.5 of her time farming, 0.3 on training, and 0.2 on free time. Ella believes that the family must prioritize food security, hence the substantial time dedicated to farming. She also recognizes the importance of strength and defense, so she will continue to train. Free time is a necessary respite from the demands of both.



        Question: In the statement, did Ella say they will devote specific fractions of time to any of the listed activities?
        (a) Yes
        (b) No
        Answer: (a)
        Question: Which individuals made a commitment to change their behavior? What commitment did each of them make? What proportion of their time will they probably spend on each activity in the future? When answering, include fractions of time spent in each activity in the format:
        `name` will spend `fraction`% of their time on `activity`. Only consider the activities listed above. Fractions should be between 0 and 1 and must sum to 1.
        Answer: Ella will spend 50% of her time farming, 30% of her time training as a warrior, and 20% of her time on free time.


1750-12-31 20:00:00 Isaac -- Isaac thinks this year was a good year, with a bountiful harvest and a successful defense against the barbarians. He feels that the villagers could have been more prepared for the barbarian attack, but overall he is pleased with how things went. He hopes next year will be just as successful.


    Event statement
  • Isaac thinks this year was a good year, with a bountiful harvest and a successful defense against the barbarians. He feels that the villagers could have been more prepared for the barbarian attack, but overall he is pleased with how things went. He hopes next year will be just as successful.


    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Setting: Ignisvallis and Drakelundh are pre-state societies. They are small villages with a few hundred people each. They are located on the coast and supported by both fishing and agriculture. The local farmers living outside the villages share cultural and economic ties with the villagers.


      Important fact: Magic is not real. Supernatural events are impossible.


      Critical premise: It is not possible to communicate with the barbarian raiders from the sea. They do not speak any language in common with the villagers. They cannot be reasoned with. They will always attempt to invade and plunder the villages.


      Fact 1: Anyone in Ignisvallis looking for Noah, or Isaac easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Ignisvallis society.
      Anyone in Drakelundh looking for Ethan, or Ella easily finds them in the village center. They are influential and respected stakeholders in Drakelundh society.


      Fact 2: Direct conversation between villagers of Ignisvallis and Drakelundh is not possible. The only possible way to communicate is through the diplomatic meeting at the hill of accord. Therefore, the two elder representatives who meet at the hill of accord constitute the only channel of communication between villages. The two elder representatives can speak directly to each other, but they can only do so while they are physically at the hill of accord. Villagers cannot participate in conversations at the hill of accord since it is far away. And villagers never travel away from their home village.

      Daily activities
      : Noah's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.4, 'farming': 0.5, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Isaac's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.6, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.1}
      Ethan's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.3, 'farming': 0.4, 'training as a warrior': 0.3}
      Ella's Daily activities
      : {'free time': 0.5, 'farming': 0.3, 'training as a warrior': 0.2}

      Payoffs: Aldous

Their axes gleamed bright, their shields held firm, and their hearts burned with the fire of courage, driving back the foul tide of darkness. With calloused hands and joyful hearts, the villagers gathered the rich harvest, a testament to their unwavering commitment to the land. Their stores were full, ensuring a season of plenty and prosperity. Each village cultivates its own lands, independent and self-reliant, with no pact to share the abundance or hardship that the earth may yield.']

          Answer: Isaac observed a successful defense against a barbarian assault and a bountiful harvest in the village.

        • [02 Jul 1748 00:00:00] When Isaac was 23 years old, he witnessed a group of barbarian raiders attack a Drakelundh patrol, their savagery shocking even him. He saw firsthand the brutality of the world beyond his villages, and he realized that Drakelundh's warrior culture, while admirable, was not enough to protect them from the true dangers that lurked in the shadows. This event solidified his belief that strength alone was not enough, and he began to contemplate the need for cunning and strategy if he was to survive and thrive in a world filled with chaos.
